title: Seasoning Rice in a Rice Cooker

items.name: Add salt before cooking
items.details: Add about 1/2 to 3/4 tsp kosher salt per cup of dry rice to the water before hitting cook. The rice absorbs the seasoned water as it cooks, so the flavor is even throughout.

items.name: Order of operations
items.details: Rice in, water to the correct line, salt into the water, then cook. Give the water a quick swirl if you want, but the salt will dissolve as it heats.

items.name: Skip pepper during cooking
items.details: Pepper gets muddy and bitter when boiled. Add pepper after fluffing, not before cooking.

items.name: Optional upgrades
items.details: Swap part of the water for broth, or add a little butter or oil before cooking for richer rice.

items.name: Firm rule
items.details: Salt before cooking, never after. Fluff at the end, then add extras like butter, pepper, or herbs.

notes: This applies when transitioning from stovetop rice (where you might season at the end) to a rice cooker. The key difference is that with a rice cooker, seasoning goes in at the start.
